snippet: The Bahrain Grand Prix will go on despite local protests against the race and continuing violence in the country. Meanwhile, the racing begins in Shanghai ahead of the China Grand Prix on Sunday.
abstract: The Bahrain Grand Prix will go on despite local protests against the race and continuing violence in the country. Meanwhile, the racing begins in Shanghai ahead of the China Grand Prix on Sunday.

headline.main: A Decision on the Bahrain Grand Prix -- Oh, and There's a Race in China Too
